hero.title: About DamDoh
hero.subtitle: Empowering Agricultural Communities Through Connection and Technology.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.p1: We envision a world where every agricultural stakeholder, regardless of size or location, has the tools and connections needed to thrive. A world with a resilient, transparent, and equitable food supply chain.
vision.p2: DamDoh was born from a desire to bridge the gaps in the agricultural sector — connecting isolated farmers to markets, providing access to vital information, and fostering a community built on shared knowledge and trust.

challenge.title: The Challenge We Address
challenge.description: The modern agricultural landscape is complex and fragmented, presenting numerous obstacles for stakeholders at every level:

list.knowledge: Knowledge Gaps: Limited access to best practices, market data, and climate-smart techniques.
list.market: Market Access: Smallholder farmers struggle to connect with larger markets and get fair prices.
list.quality: Quality & Trust: Lack of transparency and traceability makes it difficult to verify product quality and origin.
list.logistics: Inefficient Logistics: Poor coordination leads to high post-harvest losses and increased costs.
list.financial: Financial Exclusion: Difficulty accessing loans, insurance, and other financial products.
list.climate: Climate Change: Increasing uncertainty requires more resilient and adaptive farming methods.
list.informal: Informal Sector: Much of the agricultural economy operates in an informal, undocumented manner, limiting growth and investment.

solution.title: The DamDoh Solution
solution.description: We are building a comprehensive digital ecosystem to tackle these challenges head-on:

list.education: Education & Information Hub: Providing access to resources on sustainable practices like KNF and FGW.
list.ai: AI-Powered Assistance: Offering personalized advice, crop diagnosis, and market insights.
list.logistics: Logistics & Supply Chain Coordination: Tools to streamline transport and reduce waste.
list.financial: Financial Inclusion: Connecting users with financial products and building creditworthiness through platform activity.

p2p.title: Peer-to-Peer
p2p.content: We connect farmers with other farmers to share local knowledge and experiences.

p2b.title: Producer-to-Business
p2b.content: We bridge the gap between smallholder farmers and large-scale buyers, ensuring fair trade and quality.

p2w.title: Local-to-World

commitment.p1: We are committed to leveraging technology for good, creating a platform that is not only powerful but also accessible, inclusive, and user-centric.
commitment.p2: We believe in the power of community and collaboration to solve the world's most pressing agricultural challenges.
commitment.p3: Join us in cultivating a better future for agriculture.

communityGuidelines.title: Community Guidelines
communityGuidelines.subtitle: Our commitment to fostering a safe, trustworthy, and collaborative environment.
communityGuidelines.intro: DamDoh is a professional network for the agricultural community. We expect our members to conduct themselves with the highest level of integrity. These guidelines are here to ensure our platform remains a constructive and valuable resource for everyone.

respectful.title: Be Respectful and Constructive
respectful.description: Engage in discussions with courtesy. Disagreements are fine, but personal attacks, harassment, hate speech, or bullying will not be tolerated.

authentic.title: Be Authentic and Honest
authentic.description: Represent yourself and your business truthfully. Do not create fake profiles, misrepresent your products or services, or engage in deceptive practices.

relevant.title: Keep it Relevant
relevant.description: Share content that is relevant to the agricultural industry, supply chains, and professional development. Spam, scams, and irrelevant promotional content are prohibited.

fairTrade.title: Uphold Fair Trade
fairTrade.description: All transactions and interactions on the platform should be conducted fairly and ethically. Do not engage in price-fixing, fraudulent reviews, or any attempt to manipulate the marketplace.

sustainable.title: Promote Sustainability
sustainable.description: We encourage discussions and practices that promote environmental, social, and economic sustainability in agriculture. Share your knowledge and learn from others.

reporting.title: Reporting Violations
reporting.content: If you see content or behavior that violates these guidelines, please report it to our team through the reporting features on the site or by emailing us at {emailLink}.

communityGuidelines.conclusion: By using DamDoh, you agree to abide by these guidelines. Violations may result in content removal, feature limitations, or account suspension.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.introduction: This privacy policy explains how DamDoh ('we', 'us') collects, uses, and shares information about you when you use our platform and services.

whatInfoWeCollect.heading: 1. What Information We Collect
whatInfoWeCollect.content: We collect information you provide directly to us, such as when you create an account, create or modify your profile, use the interactive features of the platform, make purchases, and communicate with us directly. This includes your name, email, role, and any other information you choose to provide. We also collect log information about your use of the services.

howWeUseInfo.heading: 2. How We Use Your Information
howWeUseInfo.content: We use the information we collect to provide, maintain, and improve our services, including to process transactions, develop new features, provide customer support, and send you technical notices, updates, security alerts, and administrative messages.

willInfoBeShared.heading: 3. Will Your Information Be Shared With Anyone?
willInfoBeShared.content: We do not share your personal information with third parties except in the following cases: with your consent, with third-party vendors and service providers, for legal reasons, or in connection with a business transfer. Your public profile information will be visible to other users of the platform.

cookiesAndTracking.heading: 4. Do We Use Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies?
cookiesAndTracking.content: We may use cookies and similar tracking technologies to access or store information. Specific information about how we use such technologies and how you can refuse certain cookies is set out in our Cookie Policy.

howLongWeKeepInfo.heading: 5. How Long Do We Keep Your Information?
howLongWeKeepInfo.content: We keep your information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this privacy policy unless otherwise required by law.

howWeKeepInfoSafe.heading: 6. How Do We Keep Your Information Safe?
howWeKeepInfoSafe.content: We aim to protect your personal information through a system of organizational and technical security measures.

minors.heading: 7. Do We Collect Information From Minors?
minors.content: We do not knowingly collect data from or market to children under 18 years of age.

privacyRights.heading: 8. What Are Your Privacy Rights?
privacyRights.content: In some regions, you have certain rights under applicable data protection laws. These may include the right to request access to and obtain a copy of your personal information, to request rectification or erasure; to restrict the processing of your personal information; and if applicable, to data portability.

controlsForDoNotTrack.heading: 9. Controls for Do-Not-Track Features
controlsForDoNotTrack.content: Most web browsers and some mobile operating systems and mobile applications include a Do-Not-Track (“DNT”) feature or setting you can activate to signal your privacy preference not to have data about your online browsing activities monitored and collected.

updatesToNotice.heading: 10. Do We Make Updates to This Notice?
updatesToNotice.content: We may update this privacy notice from time to time. The updated version will be indicated by an updated “Revised” date and the updated version will be effective as soon as it is accessible.
